meanings.definition: To regard or represent as perfect or better than reality.
meanings.sent1: She keeps overidealizing her new job, thinking it will solve all her problems.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overidealize his favorite sports team, believing they can never lose.
meanings.sent3: By overidealizing her cooking skills, she ended up burning the dinner.
meanings.sent4: His overidealizing of the situation made it hard for him to accept the truth.
meanings.sent5: Overidealizing the vacation destination made it impossible for her to enjoy the trip.

meanings.definition: To have an excessively high or unrealistic opinion of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: They are overidealizing their chances of winning the competition.
meanings.sent2: She is overidealizing her celebrity crush, thinking he can do no wrong.
meanings.sent3: By overidealizing the movie, they were disappointed when it didn't meet their expectations.
meanings.sent4: His overidealizing of the project's success blinded him to potential risks.
meanings.sent5: Overidealizing the new gadget led to disappointment when it didn't work as expected.
